subject: Physical Fitness
title: Progressive Overload and Safety
description: A quick win: understand Progressive Overload and Safety.

hook.text: The same principle that builds strength also causes injury. Progressive overload is a double-edged sword.

buildup.text: Progressive overload means gradually increasing training stress to force adaptation. It's how bodies get stronger.

discovery.text: The key word is 'gradually.' Jumping from 60 kg to 100 kg on a squat skips the adaptation window.

twist.text: Under-loading is also a risk. Tissues that aren't challenged enough lose capacity over time. Too little is dangerous.

climax.text: The sweet spot is small, consistent increases â€” 2.5% to 10% per week â€” that challenge without overwhelming tissue.

punchline.text: Progress gradually, not aggressively. Small jumps build; big jumps break.
